frame.name: Ceasing_to_be
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> ceases to exist.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Entire platoons</fex> have <fex name="Manner">mysteriously</fex> <t>vanished</t> <fex name="Place">from battle</fex>, leaving enemy weapons to slice through empty air.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>Concrete or abstract entity that does not exist after the event.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the Place where the new <fen>Entity</fen> ceases to exist.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifes the Time when a new <fen>Entity</fen> ceases to be.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE labels the <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> of the destruction or disappearance of the <fen>Entity</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Components
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the components into which the <fen>Entity</fen> dissipates. </def-root>

FE.name: Duration_of_final_state
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the length of time before the <fen>Entity</fen> comes into existence again.</def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition: <def-root>The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which no longer exists. </def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Period_of_iterations</fen> during which habitual or iterative actions are performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The completeness of the disappearance of the <fen>Entity</fen></def-root>
